src:
Umar Sadik: Nisam čuo da se neko žali kako ne postižem golove
Nigerijac protiv Vojvodine stigao do desetog pogotka u sezoni, kaže da Partizan i u Mančesteru mora da pokaže ispravan stav
03 Nov 2019 by Aleksandar Joksić
Prvi Partizanov fudbaler sa dvocifrenim brojem pogodaka u sezoni. Izuzetno značajan za način igre tima Sava Miloševića, posebno u evropskim utakmicama. Miljenik navijača. Kad se posmatraju statistika i aplauzi sa tribina svaki put kad napusti teren reklo bi se da je Umar Sadik i pre zimske pauze zaslužio da čelnici crno-belih otkupe njegov ugovor od Rome, međutim , u delu javnosti i dalje provejava dilema da li je kvalitet vredan 1.600.000 evra.
Posebno što i među Grobarima, istim onim koji ga nagrađuju pesmom od utakmice do utakmice, vlada saglasje da nije gol-igrač. Opet, dati deset komada do početka novembra učinak je za poštovanje.“Iskren da budem, ne znam da se neko žalio kako ne postižem golove. Nikad nisam čuo tako nešto”, uverava Sadik posle meča sa Vojvodinom (4:0), na kom je stigao do jubileja. “Ovde sam da bih pomogao saigračima, zarad Partizana, a ne da bih ulepšavao svoj profil  i statistiku. To i radim, videli ste da sam protiv Novosađana dvaput asistirao”.
Kao što Parni valjak nekad vozi punom brzinom, a nekad u leru, tako oscilira i visoki Nigerijac. Za razliku od gostovanja Čukaričkom, gde ga je Darko Puškarić u potpunosti izbacio iz igre, u subotnjem nominalnom derbiju 15. superligaškog kola toliko je mučio defanzivce Voše, Saničanina i Đurića, da su jedva dočekali kad je 18 minuta pre kraja ustupio mesto na terenu Đorđu Ivanoviću.“Igra je bila kvalitetna, ali moram da nastavim u istom ritmu. Da ne bude samo jedna utakmica. Jeste dobar učinak za napadača, drago mi je zbog toga, samo se nadam da ćemo kao ekipa nastaviti da napredujemo. Potrebno je da u svakom kolu pokažem šta mogu, a uprkos pritisku koji smo osećali pokazali smo da smo za tako nešto sposobni”.
Asistirao je Sadik u subotu Bibrasu Nathu i Saši Zdjelaru, između toga efektnim matiranjem Emila Rockova, sa slične pozicije odakle je protiv Mančestera uzdrmao stativu, pomogao Partizanu da brzo preboli neuspeh na Banovom brdu“Nikad nije lako vratiti se posle poraza. Pokazali smo snažan karakter, što smo i očekivali, jer smo hteli da demonstriramo kako smo i na psihološkom planu jaki. To mi je posebno drago. Moramo da uđemo u svaki meč snažno, od prvog minuta, kao što je bio slučaj u subotu”.



Sad je jedna od ključnih debata u klubu i navijačkim krugovima, da li Umar Sadik, sa jednakim samopouzdanjem kakvim je pre desetak dana napao Harija Megvajera i Fila Džounsa, može da namuči štopere Mančestera i na Old Trafordu.“Nikad se ne zna. Moramo i u Engleskoj da pokažemo ispravan mentalitet, videćemo šta će nam to doneti. Za mene će utakmica na Old Trafordu biti poseban doživljaj, jer inače navijam za Mančester. Jedva čekam da počne”, uzbuđen je tamnoputi centarfor, a na pitanje da li crno-beli mogu da prirede senzaciju uzvraća mirno. “Sve je stvar mentaliteta. Ako istrčimo sa ispravim stavom možda možemo da ostvarimo nešto. Može nekad da se desi da igrate dobro, a izgubite, kao što je bio slučaj protiv Junajteda u Beogradu, ali nikad se ne zna. Videćemo u četvrtak”.
Jedino što se čini da je Partizanu lakše da igra, da se nosi, sa rivalima na evropskoj sceni, nego na srpskoj. Možda je to osnov na kome Grobari grade nadu pred put u Englesku.“Nema lake utakmice u fudbalu. Makar bio i kup meč. Ako niste spremni - ispašćete. Nijedan rival ne može olako da se shvati. U Ligi Evrope smo igrali protiv Mančestera, izgubili smo, a onda smo šest dana kasnije poraženi i u susretu domaćeg prvenstva, što govori u prilog tome da nema lakih utakmica”, obazirv je Umar Sadik.
Kad bi i na Teatru snova bio nepredvidiv…
Foto: Starsport
text:
Umar Sadik: I have not heard anyone complain about not scoring goals
Nigerian against Vojvodina reaches tenth goal of the season, says Partizan must show correct attitude in Manchester
03 Nov 2019 by Aleksandar Joksic
Partizan's first footballer with double-digit hits in a season. Extremely significant for the way Savo Milosevic's team plays, especially in European games. Fan favorite. Looking at the statistics and rounds of applause from the stands every time he leaves the field, it would be said that even before the winter break, Umar Sadik deserved the black and white leaders to buy his contract from Roma, however, in the public part he still raises the dilemma of whether the quality is worth it. € 1,600,000.
Especially as among Grobari, the same ones who reward him with song from match to match, the government agrees that he is not a goal-player. Again, giving ten pieces by early November is an effect for respect. ”To be honest, I don't know that anyone complained about not scoring goals. I have never heard such a thing, ”assures Sadik after the match with Vojvodina (4: 0), at which he reached the jubilee. "I'm here to help teammates, for the sake of Partizan, not to beautify my profile and statistics. That's what I do, you saw that I assisted twice against Novi Sad. "
Just as the Steam Roller sometimes drives at full speed and sometimes in the back, so does the tall Nigerian. Unlike visiting Čukarički, where Darko Pushkaric completely threw him out of the game, in Saturday's nominal derby of the 15th Super League he tortured defenders Voša, Saničanin and Đurić so much that they barely welcomed him when he gave way to Djordje 18 minutes before the end. Ivanovic. "The game was good quality, but I have to continue at the same pace. Not just one game. Have a good effect for the striker, I'm glad about that, I just hope that as a team we will continue to make progress. It is necessary for me to show in each round what I can, and despite the pressure we have felt, we have shown that we are capable of something like that. "
Assisting Sadik on Saturday to Bibras Nath and Sasha Zdjelar, among them effectively matting Emil Rockov, from a similar position from where he slammed a tripod against Manchester, helped Partizan quickly get over the failure at Ban Hill. "It's never easy to come back after defeat. We showed a strong character, which we expected, because we wanted to demonstrate how strong we are in the psychological plane. I am particularly pleased with that. We need to get into every match strongly, from the first minute, as was the case on Saturday. "



Now one of the key debates in the club and fan circles is whether Umar Sadik, with the same confidence that he attacked Harry Megweyer and Phil Jones about ten days ago, can harass the Manchester stoppers at Old Trafford. ”One never knows. We also need to show the right mentality in England, we will see what that will bring to us. For me, the match at Old Traford will be a special experience, as I usually cheer for Manchester. I can't wait for it to start, ”the dark-skinned centerframe excited, and when asked if black and whites could produce the sensation, it responded calmly. "It's all a matter of mentality. If we run out with the right attitude, maybe we can accomplish something. You may sometimes play well and lose, as was the case against United in Belgrade, but you never know. We'll see on Thursday. "
The only thing that seems to be easier for Partizan is to play, to deal with, the rivals on the European stage, than in the Serbian one. Perhaps this is the basis on which the Gravediggers build hope before traveling to England. ”There is no easy match in football. Even if it was a cup match. If you are not ready - you will fall out. No rival can easily grasp it. In the Europa League we played against Manchester, we lost, and then six days later we were defeated in the match of the domestic championship, which proves that there are no easy matches, ”said Umar Sadik.
If the Theater of Dreams was unpredictable ...
Photo: Starsport
